neighbors.name: E. B. Stuckey Jr.
neighbors.claims: E. B. Stuckey Jr. is listed as the owner of two parcels in Lee County, South Carolina[Lee County GIS (ArcGIS) Service](https://services8.arcgis.com/GcPtFFAsQfUqzpLm/ArcGIS/rest/services/BBCA_resident_layers_v1_020725/FeatureServer/6)[Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/E-B-Stuckey/Bishopville-SC). No record of Stuckey making public comments on local development or energy projects was found in news archives or county meeting minutes[The Sumter Item](https://www.theitem.com/stories/lee-county-council-minutes,31510)[SC Press Association Archives](http://scpress.org/sclivesearch).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via a respected local farming community member to acknowledge his family’s ties to the land and address any concerns about land use or legacy.

neighbors.name: James C. Tolbert & Ruth W. Tolbert
neighbors.claims: James C. Tolbert and his wife Ruth W. Tolbert jointly own a rural parcel in Lee County[Lee County GIS (ArcGIS) Service](https://services8.arcgis.com/GcPtFFAsQfUqzpLm/ArcGIS/rest/services/BBCA_resident_layers_v1_020725/FeatureServer/6). They are listed as residents of the Bishopville area in public directory records[Whitepages](https://www.whitepages.com/name/James-Tolbert/Bishopville-SC). No public statements or civic roles for the Tolberts were found in available local records[SC Press Association Archives](http://scpress.org/sclivesearch).

approach_recommendations.engage: Use a neighborly, personal approach (perhaps via a mutual acquaintance) emphasizing respect for their property and maintaining the quiet rural character they value.

overview_summary: Neither neighbor has a documented public stance on the proposed development (0 support, 0 oppose, 2 unknown). Their community influence ranges from low to moderate, with no high-influence neighbors identified in this group.
